citations.narrative:
The dates of administration for antibiotics given to the adult dog “Angus” were not recorded in full. While the facility
representatives gave the medication as prescribed, multiple dates were not documented in the electronic or paper records
to reflect both doses given. Proper record keeping is necessary to ensure that the guidance of the attending veterinarian
is being followed, and helps the facility verify that medications were administered as outlined in the program of veterinary
care. The facility must keep and maintain the names of all vaccines and treatments and the dates of administration given
to dogs at the facility.
Correct by December 9, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.13(b)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The dates of administration for antibiotics given to the adult dog “Angus” were not recorded in full. While the facility 
representatives gave the medication as prescribed, multiple dates were not documented in the electronic or paper records 
to reflect both doses given. Proper record keeping is necessary to ensure that the guidance of the attending veterinarian 
is being followed, and helps the facility verify that medications were administered as outlined in the program of veterinary 
care. The facility must keep and maintain the names of all vaccines and treatments and the dates of administration given 
to dogs at the facility. 
 
Correct by December 9, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
